ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:0.4_0: The training rules on asking for oil ... honey ... syrup ... fish ... meat ... milk ... curd
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were eating food that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.3_0: ... were eating honey that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.4_0: ... were eating syrup that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.5_0: ... were eating syrup that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.6_0: ... were eating meat that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.7_0: ... were drinking milk that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.8_0: ... were eating curd that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.9_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.10_0: “How can nuns eat curd that they have asked for?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.11_0: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.12_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.13_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.14_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six eat curd that they have asked for?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.15_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.18_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.19_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.20_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.21.1_0: ‘If a nun eats curd that she has asked for, she must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.22_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.23_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.1_0: Soon afterwards a number of nuns were sick.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.2_0: The nuns who were looking after them asked,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.3_0: “I hope you’re bearing up, Venerable, I hope you’re getting better?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.4_0: “Previously we ate curd that we had asked for, and then we were comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.5_0: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.6_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.7_0: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to eat curd that she has asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.8_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.9.1_0: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for (oil ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.1_0: curd and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.2_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.8_0: who is not comfortable without people.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.10_0: sesame oil, mustard-seed oil, honey-tree oil, castor oil, oil from fat.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.16_0: what lives in water is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.18_0: the meat of those animals whose meat is allowable.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.20_0: milk from cows, milk from goats, milk from buffaloes, or milk from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.23_0: If he is not sick and he asks for himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.24_0: When he receives it with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.25_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.1_0: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.2_0: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.3_0: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.4_0: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.5_0: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.6_0: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.3_0: if she asked for it when she was sick, but eats it when she is no longer sick;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.4_0: if she eats the leftovers from one who is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.7_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.8_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.10_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.11_0: The eighth training rule entailing acknowledgment is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.12_0: “Venerables, the eight rules on acknowledgment have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.13_0: In regard to this I ask you,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.19_0: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.20_0: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
